alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 07 at 2:35PM PST until March 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 18 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Mountains of Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 1500 to 2500 feet through Wednesday. Snow levels 3000 to 5000 feet Thursday, rising quickly to 6000 to 8000 feet by Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County
